unnormalised: **Entertainment: Bollywood Releases - Will the Box Office Need a Painkiller?**
normalised: Entertainment: Bollywood Releases - Will the Box Office Need a Painkiller?

unnormalised: Bollywood's churning out movies faster than your aunty can make biryani during Eid. This week sees a clash of the titans (or at least, moderately successful uncles) at the box office.
normalised: Bollywood's churning out movies faster than your aunty can make biryani during Eid. This week sees a clash of the titans (or at least, moderately successful uncles) at the box office.

unnormalised: "Dhoom Dhadaka 3," starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor, promises more gravity-defying stunts and questionable fashion choices. Critics are already predicting plot holes bigger than the potholes on Mumbai's Western Express Highway.
normalised: "Dhoom Dhadaka three," starring the perpetually youthful Anil Kapoor, promises more gravity-defying stunts and questionable fashion choices. Critics are already predicting plot holes bigger than the potholes on Mumbai's Western Express Highway.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, "Sharmaji Ka Yoga Mishap" featuring the ever-reliable Paresh Rawal, hopes to tickle your funny bone with accidental enlightenment and awkward downward-facing dogs. Word on the street (aka Filmfare magazine) is that it's inspired by Baba Ramdev's early morning routine.
normalised: Meanwhile, "Sharmaji Ka Yoga Mishap" featuring the ever-reliable Paresh Rawal, hopes to tickle your funny bone with accidental enlightenment and awkward downward-facing dogs. Word on the street (aka Filmfare magazine) is that it's inspired by Baba Ramdev's early morning routine.

unnormalised: Early predictions suggest "Dhoom Dhadaka 3" might rake in Rs. 50 crore in its opening weekend, while "Sharmaji" is hoping for a respectable Rs. 25 crore.
normalised: Early predictions suggest "Dhoom Dhadaka three" might rake in rupee fifty crore in its opening weekend, while "Sharmaji" is hoping for a respectable rupee twenty five crore.

unnormalised: But will either film surpass the monumental success of last month's "Karan Arjun Reloaded," which is still playing in single-screen theaters in Patna? Only time (and the relentless promotions on Kapil Sharma’s show) will tell.
normalised: But will either film surpass the monumental success of last month's "Karan Arjun Reloaded," which is still playing in single-screen theaters in Patna? Only time (and the relentless promotions on Kapil Sharma’s show) will tell.

unnormalised: So grab your popcorn, brace yourselves, and remember, even if the movies are terrible, at least you can blame the traffic for being late! Happy watching, and may the best film win (or at least, not completely bomb). Maybe they'll all release again on Onam.
normalised: So grab your popcorn, brace yourselves, and remember, even if the movies are terrible, at least you can blame the traffic for being late! Happy watching, and may the best film win (or at least, not completely bomb). Maybe they'll all release again on Onam.
